sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均有"锐利的，敏锐的，机敏的"之意。
means: keen ： 多指对复杂艰深的事物或问题有敏锐的观察和敏捷的理解。
acute ： 侧重感觉敏锐，能分辨出一般人难以觉察的细微区别。
sharp ： 指人头脑精明、敏锐或机警。
shrewd ： 指有头脑，善于判断分析，精明过人。

sentence.Network_en: I felt a sharp pain in my lower back.
sentence.Network_cn: 我感觉到后腰一阵剧痛。

sentence.Network_en: Futures prices recovered from sharp early declines to end with moderate losses.
sentence.Network_cn: 期货价格在早盘深幅下跌后出现反弹，收盘时未见严重损失。

sentence.Network_en: There was a sharp fall in the value of the pound.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English sc(e)arp, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch scherp and German scharf

encyclopedia.content: SHARP （夏普）夏普自1912年创业以来，发明了成为公司名称来源的活芯铅笔，研制成功了日本国产，第一号收音机和电视机，在世界首次推出电子，计算器和液晶显示器等等，始终勇于开创新领域

entry.def: A sharp point or edge is very thin and can cut through things very easily. A sharp knife, tool, or other object has a point or edge of this kind.

example.ex: The other end of the twig is sharpened into a sharp point to use as a toothpick...
example.tran: 细枝的另一端被削尖用作牙签。

example.ex: Using a sharp knife, cut away the pith and peel from both fruits...
example.tran: 用一把锋利的刀削去两种水果的外皮和中果皮。

entry.def: You can describe a shape or an object as sharp if part of it or one end of it comes to a point or forms an angle.

example.ex: His nose was thin and sharp.
example.tran: 他的鼻子又细又尖。

example.ex: ...black sharp-toed cowboy boots.
example.tran: 黑色尖头牛仔靴

entry.def: A sharp bend or turn is one that changes direction suddenly.

example.ex: I was approaching a fairly sharp bend that swept downhill to the left.
example.tran: 我正驶向下坡路上一个突然向左的急转弯。

entry.tran: (人)敏锐的，灵敏的，敏捷的，机灵的
entry.def: If you describe someone as sharp, you are praising them because they are quick to notice, hear, understand, or react to things.

example.ex: He is very sharp, a quick thinker and swift with repartee...
example.tran: 他非常机敏，反应很快，并且能说会道。

example.ex: Gates is known to be a superb analyst with a sharp eye and an excellent memory.
example.tran: 盖茨是公认的杰出分析家，他目光敏锐且记忆力超群。

entry.tran: (言辞)激烈的，尖锐的，尖刻的，严厉的
entry.def: If someone says something in a sharp way, they say it suddenly and rather firmly or angrily, for example because they are warning or criticizing you.

example.ex: 'Don't contradict your mother,' was Charles's sharp reprimand...
example.tran: “不要和你妈妈顶嘴，”查尔斯严厉地斥责道。

example.ex: That ruling had drawn sharp criticism from civil rights groups.
example.tran: 那项判决已遭到了民权组织的严厉批评。

entry.tran: (变化、动作、感情等)急剧的，骤然的，大幅度的，强烈的
entry.def: A sharp change, movement, or feeling occurs suddenly, and is great in amount, force, or degree.

example.ex: There's been a sharp rise in the rate of inflation...
example.tran: 通货膨胀率已大幅上升。

example.ex: Tennis requires a lot of short sharp movements...
example.tran: 打网球需要做大量快速而剧烈的动作。

entry.tran: (差异)明显的，鲜明的;(图像、声音等)清晰的
entry.def: A sharp difference, image, or sound is very easy to see, hear, or distinguish.

example.ex: Many people make a sharp distinction between humans and other animals...
example.tran: 很多人认为人类和其他动物截然不同。

example.ex: Her reticence was in sharp contrast to the glamour and star status of her predecessors...
example.tran: 她的寡言少语和前任们的光鲜亮丽、明星范儿十足形成了鲜明的对比。

entry.tran: (味道或气味)强烈的，苦的，冲的
entry.def: A sharp taste or smell is rather strong or bitter, but is often also clear and fresh.

example.ex: ...a colourless, almost odourless liquid with a sharp, sweetish taste...
example.tran: 一种几乎无气味的无色液体,尝起来微甜，味道很冲

example.ex: In the hot sun the rain-washed herbs smelled sharp and spicy and sweet all at once.
example.tran: 烈日下，被雨水冲刷过的香草闻起来既冲又香气扑鼻。

entry.def: A sharp wind, or sharp cold, is so strong or intense that it almost hurts you when you are exposed to it.

example.ex: The wind was not as sharp and cruel as it had been.
example.tran: 风不像刚才那么凛冽和凶猛了。

entry.def: Sharp clothes are neat, elegant, and fashionable.

example.ex: Now politics is all about the right haircut and a sharp suit...
example.tran: 现在政界讲究的无非是合适的发型和时髦的衣着。

example.ex: A sharp dresser, Wyatt is never seen in casual clothes.
example.tran: 怀亚特衣着入时，从未有人见过他穿便装。

entry.def: Sharp is used after stating a particular time to show that something happens at exactly the time stated.

example.ex: She planned to unlock the store at 8.00 sharp this morning.
example.tran: 她打算今天早上 8 点整准时开门营业。

entry.tran: (用于音符后)升半音的(常用＃符号表示)
entry.def: Sharp is used after a letter representing a musical note to show that the note should be played or sung half a tone higher. Sharp is often represented by the symbol #.

example.ex: A solitary viola plucks a lonely, soft F sharp.
example.tran: 一把中提琴独自奏出了一个寂寞柔和的升F 调。

entry.tran: (活动或工作中)最困难的部分，最危险的部分
entry.def: If you say that someone is at the sharp end of a particular activity or type of work, you mean that they are involved in the most difficult or dangerous aspects of it.

example.ex: Vincent French is a real estate broker at the sharp end of a tough and exacting business...
example.tran: 文森特·弗伦奇在房地产这个艰难行业做了最吃苦受累的不动产经纪人。

example.ex: Working at the sharp end, many of us have noted an increase in the number of patients attending surgeries.
example.tran: 从事一线工作，我们很多人已经注意到来做手术的病人越来越多。

means.word_mean: 1. a musical notation indicating one half step higher than the note named
2. a long thin sewing needle with a sharp point
1. (of something seen or heard) clearly defined;

sentences.sentence: "the crisp snap of dry leaves underfoot"

means.word_mean: 3. having or demonstrating ability to recognize or draw fine distinctions;

sentences.sentence: "an acute observer of politics and politicians"
"as sharp and incisive as the stroke of a fang"
"an astute tenant always reads the small print in a lease"
"he was too shrewd to go along with them on a road that could lead only to their overthrow"
"the precipitous rapids of the upper river"

means.word_mean: 8. keenly and painfully felt; as if caused by a sharp edge or point;
9. very penetrating and clear and sharp in operation;
10. having or made by a thin edge or sharp point; suitable for cutting or piercing;
12. raised in pitch by one chromatic semitone;
13. very sudden and in great amount or degree;

sentences.sentence: "a sharp drop in the stock market"

means.word_mean: 1. changing suddenly in direction and degree;

sentences.sentence: "the road twists sharply after the light"

auth_sentence.content: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.
auth_sentence.res_content: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Cut the lobster in half using a sharp knife.

auth_sentence.content: Elliott Sharp is the definitive Downtown New York musician.
auth_sentence.res_content: Elliott Sharp is the definitive Downtown New York musician.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Elliott Sharp is the definitive Downtown New York musician.

auth_sentence.content: Maybe the actual publication is still neat and sharp.
auth_sentence.res_content: Maybe the actual publication is still neat and sharp.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Maybe the actual publication is still neat and sharp.

Sentence.sentence: Besides the sharp increase in oil prices, OPEC's 1973 oil embargo caused panic in the West.
They put up with the inevitable sharp increase of different taxes.
Their brains become both calmer and sharper.

sentences.en: Be careful with that sharp axe.
sentences.cn: 那把斧子很锋利, 你要当心。

means.word_mean: 急转的, 陡峭的; 突然的, 急剧的,骤然的

sentences.en: There is a sharp bend in the road.

means.word_mean: 轮廓鲜明的; 明显的; 清晰的

sentences.en: Black hair is a sharp contrast to a fair skin.
sentences.cn: 黑色的头发与白皙的皮肤形成鲜明对比。

sentences.en: There were sharp differences of opinion between the two.
sentences.cn: 两者的意见存在着明显的分歧。

means.word_mean: 灵敏的, 机警的; 人或人的头脑、眼睛等敏锐的, 灵敏的, 敏捷的

sentences.en: Birds have sharp eyes and dogs have sharp noses.
sentences.cn: 鸟有敏锐的视力, 而狗有灵敏的嗅觉。

sentences.en: The girl is sharp at music.
sentences.cn: 这个女孩对音乐的感受力很敏锐。

means.word_mean: 辛辣的, 刺骨[鼻, 眼, 耳]的

sentences.en: The branch broke with a sharp crack.
sentences.cn: 树枝折断时发出刺耳的劈啪声。

sentences.en: This salad dressing has a sharp taste.
sentences.cn: 这种色拉调味品味道辛辣。

means.word_mean: 蓄意中伤的; 尖刻的; 严厉的; 人或言语尖锐的, 尖刻的

sentences.en: She got a sharp reproach from her boss.
sentences.cn: 她受到了上司的严厉训斥。

sentences.en: I have to be sharp with him.
Please be on hand at 12 sharp.
sentences.cn: 请在十二点整到这里来。

sentences.en: The road turns sharp to the left.

jushi.english: Birds have sharp eyes and dogs have sharp noses.
jushi.chinese: 鸟有敏锐的视力,而狗有灵敏的嗅觉。

jushi.english: His sharp business dealings earned him a bad reputation.
jushi.chinese: 他靠欺诈经商,名声很坏。
